review_blob: Very nice.  Sweet, caramel,  bourbon.  Makes me want to find other faros (maybe older faros even).
Very chocolatey, its the primary aroma and flavor.  I could eat chocolate anytime and similarly, I could drink this anytime.

This is probably the best beer Ive had so far.  I like chocolate, I like raspberries- this has both and does it well.  I took a point off for the palate but thats just to be consistent- I give most things a 4 for the palate unless they really stand out, but it was smooth.  This beer just makes me happy and I dont know what more I could ask for.  Thanks yjb for this one.  A nice beer from a nice guy.

Red.  Smells like caramel, maple, sweet honey and sugar.  Similar flavor but now I notice the alcohol.  Also in the flavor it seems fruity (apples even) and spicier than I would have guessed given the aroma.  Full bodied, thick palate.

Smells very very sweet and like graham crackers.  Smooth and thick palate, roasty with vanilla, chocolate, malty and in the finish its super sweet- almost a fruity sweetness but not really..just very sweet.  I like it.
beer_name: Great Divide Yeti Imperial Stout - Oak Aged

review_blob: Color is red with a huge offwhite head, looks nice enough.  Smells and tastes like cinnamon, some general spice.  It has a smooth palate.  More pumpkin in the aroma than the flavor.  I generally dont like pumpkin, but this beer is pretty good.

Cloud orange-red color with a medium off-white head.  The aroma is nice, I can smell grapes, cherries and dates, caramel- just generally very sweet.  The flavor is a bit disappointing compared to the aroma.  Its similar though, with the fruits including apples, some woodyness, some sourness, even some vanilla.  Medium carbonation.

Golden yellow color with a medium white head.  Smells like orange, general citrus, malt and spices.  There is sourness in the flavor but also malty and sugary with some lemon.  Tart finish.   Very drinkable but still such a full flavor, nice.

Red-brown in color with almost no head.  In the aroma there is caramel, brown sugar sweetness with some straw-hay and a good deal of hops.  The sweetness in the aroma is not really present in the flavor- instead, both the alcohol and hops are strong, and its very bitter.  I also detect some fruit (grapes maybe).

Looks nice- clear dark orange color with a thin dense white head.   Nice balance between malt and hops.  In the aroma there is lots of malt, some wood and sweetness (and maybe some fruit- but mango or something like that).  The flavor has the hops, some bitterness to go along with them, and overall is very similar to the aroma- but maybe the fruits come out a bit more, especially in the finish.  Smooth palate, medium bodied.

A pale light yellow in color with a bubbly white head.  It has a malty aroma with sugar and general sweetness.  The hops come out more in the flavor which is slightly fruity and bitter, and simple.  It is drinkable and refreshing- without the nice aroma though Im not sure Id be a big fan.  .

This has a huge fluffy white head, its like a root beer float or a snowman in a cup or whipped cream.  Its so big though that its very hard to drink without waiting a long time.  It smells malty, citrusy and hoppy.  The flavor is great- Its hoppy but also super creamy, with vanilla and malt.  For something with this much hops, the creamy flavor is surprising.  Blueberries and cherries.  This is a great beer! Very bitter finish but also a touch of something sweet like maybe caramel.

2006.  Very very brown in color with a medium-small tan head.  A lot of ginger in the aroma, also super spicy, sweet and some malt (even a faint amount of chocolate).  I thought it tasted like bread and lots of spices and roast- but not so much of the ginger in the flavor.  Its one of the better spice/herb/vege beers that Ive tried so far!  I initially rated this a 3.4, but bumped the overall up one because its so good in the style.
beer_name: Anchor Our Special Ale (2005 and later)

review_blob: It smells very hoppy, with some citrus fruits and metallic.  It tastes very similar with a dry and bitter finish and medium body.  Its also very sweet, almost a caramel sweetness.  There is definitely some alcohol in there, noticeable in the flavor more than the aroma.

This beer looks average- orange in color with a small white head.  It is sweet (pnista says honey, and I think thats right on), malty, the flavor seems a bit spicy, especially in the finish; some nuts.  Drinkable. Great flavors, but they are subdued and soft.  I like it.

This is my first flemish sour ale.  I though the aroma was a lot like an avergae belgian but with bananas and malty.  In the flavor, it was a bit citrusy or maybe vinegary or generally acidic, but in a nice way (not overwhelming).  It does seem a bit empty though, especially at the end.  Its definitely interesting.
This beer looks nice- very dark with a thin-medium brown head.  It smells rich and chocolatey, which I like.  Lots of roast in the flavor.  Dry finish with some hops.  Its simple but very enjoyable.

It looks and smells nicer than non-oaked arrogant bastard.  The oak/ general wood flavors come out most in the finish, and adds a nice touch.  Its hoppy, bitter.  Some fruit and caramel in the aroma.  Full bodied.  I like it better than the original.

Looks ok but not spectacular- a big white head and orange in color.  Smells very malty, some citrusy fruits and flowers.  Grassy flavor, also very herbal, hoppy.  Dry finish.  Overall, I think the aroma is great and the rest of the beer is decent- but its definitely unique and that alone makes me want more of it.

A very unexciting appearance- sort of a dull hazy orange-yellow with no head.  Smells strange, slightly fruity, slightly malty, some bread.  And it has a very similar flavor.  A surprisingly full bodied beer, and very drinkable on top of that, mostly because the flavor is non-offensive enough, but there was nothing special going on at all.

Orangish color with a large and dense white head.  The aroma is malty with sugary sweetness and candy, light fruits, and floral hops.  The flavor is similar but maybe with a bit of spice and less hops than expected.  Its very drinkable.
Clear orange in color with a small bubbly white head.  Malty, grassy, a touch of citrus fruits and a touch of caramel.  This beer is highly drinkable and full of flavor, not bad overall.

The first thing I notice is bananas in the aroma, lots of bananas.  Its yellow in color with a medium-big fluffy white head.  Some other fruits in the aroma (especially citrus), a touch of vanilla and spice.  The flavor is similar with bananas sticking out the most but more subdued than in the aroma.  Its a shame I dislike bananas.

It looks cloudy and orange.  Its hoppy, fruity (citrusy like orange, but also apple), grainy, and grassy.  The flavor and aroma are similar, but there is somethign weird about the aroma so the flavor gets an extra point.

Well, I thought I might like this because I always wanted arrogant bastard to be maltier, but I think there is too much bitterness and alcohol in the flavor.  I love the aroma, which is super malty with some fruits like apples and maybe even papaya, some hops, and bread/yeast.  Similar flavor and very rich but the hops go way up.  I think this beer is good, it certainly has a lot going on and even looks very nice, but maybe just a bit too intense for me!

Light orange in color with a medium sized head.  It smells hoppy, fruity, refreshing.  There is a bit of an emptyness in the flavor- I get more out of the aftertaste than anything else, which is super bitter and hoppy with some citrus.  Its clean and refreshing in a way, because of the almost watery nature of the flavor, but also has those huge hops.  I think its pretty good.

This one is good, its black with a thick dark brown (creamy looking) head.  It somes nice, chocolate and roasty.  The alcohol starts to dominate in the flavor though, but there still is big roast, chocolate, malt, and sweetness (almost fruity, but not quite).  The palate is super thick and creamy, its like a smooth milkshake.

Brewed in 2005.  Orange color.  Its very sweet, caramel and grapes, alcohol (especially in the finish). Creamy.  Very complex- as I drink more, I notice more flavors/aromas like bananas, bread/grains, vanilla.

Clear orange color with a thin creamy head.  Both the aroma and flavor have lots of malt, thats the most noticeable component.  Beyond that, theres a bit of citrusy sweetness in the flavor, and a bitter finish.  Very drinkable, low to medium carbonation, no offensive flavors, full but not heavy.

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob: I liked it before I opened it just because of the name.  It smells like caramel and generally like a barleywine except theres a lot of hops in the aroma also.  Some alcohol.  Thick creamy consistency.  THe hops are big in the flavor too along with caramel, fruits, a bit of spice and general sweetness.  The alcohol becomes noticeable in the finish.  Its good.
beer_name: Hair of the Dog Doggie Claws (2003-)

review_blob: It has a huge fluffy head and it kind of looks like a root beer float, Id say it looks nice.  Smells and tastes similar- very sweet, fruity like apples, a bit spicy, malty and the alcohol is very detectable but not necessarily entirely out of place.

An orange-brown color with a creamy white head.  This beer smells like brown sugar, butterscotch, grapes, a bit of sourness.  Tastes similar with dark fruits, alcohol, cinammon, caramel.  I guess there is a lot going on, because I keep thinking of knew things I taste in it.  I would say its not bad, but the alcohol is a bit much in the flavor, and the mouthfeel is a bit rough.

A nice deep red color with a medium sized tan head.  The aroma is not super strong, but whats there is nice.  It smells very malty, chocolate, some caramel, and some woody scents.  The strong hops come out in the flavor, but the malt is still there, a good deal of bitterness and maybe some spice.  It is well balanced but there is also a lot going on.

This one is weird.  A clear yellow color with a white head.  It smells and tastes like bread and vegetables.  Some light fruitiness in the aroma.  The hops are very subdued.  It definitely tastes unique, but unfortunately I just dont think I can handle a full bottle of it-- the flavors are too weird and out of place.

Brown/red color with a medium sized creamy head that quickly leaves.  Smells a bit like root beer and light caramel.  Tastes similar, sweet, slightly roasty, slightly fruity like apples/pears.  Lots of carbonation, too much.
beer_name: Samuel Adams James Madison Dark Wheat Ale

review_blob: I was not a huge fan.  It is orange in color with almost no head- some lacing.  Smells like caramel, malt, hops, a bit sweet.  More of a fruity hoppy flavor, watery, slight bitter finish.

Bottled in 2004.  Batch 5.  Wow this is great!  Its like chocolate flavored whipped cream, because its smooth creamy, and almost fluffy on the palate, with a rich chocolatey taste.  It also has some roasted malt, caramel, a bit of fruitier sweetness in the finish, some noticeable alcohol but mostly in the aroma, and some hops in the flavor.  It looks pretty nice too, super dark with a dark brown head.  I dont really have anything bad to say about this beer, aside from the extra alcohol that takes over a bit too much in the aroma.  Delicious!

Clear orange-brown in color, medium sized bubbly white head.  Smells like fruit, poppy seeds, bread, veggies, spices.  Tastes tangy, sweet, spicey.  Its tastes and smells a bit strange, I think, and is slightly offensive.

This is a nice well rounded beer, my favorite in the style so far.  It is a cloudy yellow orange color with a huge fluffy white head.  In the aroma there is some peppermint, some sourness, apple/fruit, very malty, sugary cotton candy.  The flavor is similar with more hops, spice, and bitterness.  Its very drinkable, with a nice smooth palate.

Its dark red/black in color.  Its super chocolatey!!  Chocolate is the primary aroma and flavor, and its very sweet and malty, and a bit creamy.  Faint vanilla and fruit.  Mostly, its like liquid watered down chocolate, which is nice!

In appearance, this beer is a golden yellow/brown color with a thin white head.  The aroma is great- I get citrus fruits, melon, papaya, sweet and sugary, brown sugar, light caramel, hops.  The flavor is similar--hoppy, bitter, juicy and fruity.  The price is right, its hoppy and full of flavor, I like it.

Looks orange with a very large fluffy white head.  Smells like apples and pears, spices, and bread/dough.  The spicyness and hops both come out more in the flavor, and the apple is still there along with other fruits like cranberry/plum/etc.  The ginger is not overpowering, and adds a nice touch.  Its a bit watery, and I feel like these flavors really come out best in the end/ lingering aftertaste.  Also, its a bit over carbonated.  The flavor combinations are good though, and I enjoyed it!

2005. This beer has a sort of pinkish orange color and a thin tan head.  Smells malty and like bread and caramel.  Tastes similar but pretty heavy on the alcohol, more hops and more spice, some light fruit especially in the finish.  A fairly thick palate.

Its a yellow color with a hint of orange and a small white head.  This beer is very drinkable, almost too much so.  It smells very much like pumpkin, and tastes very spicey with maybe carrots and cinammon, some malt, some light fruit.

It has an orange-yellow color with a large white head.  It has apples, pears, sugar and blackberries in the aroma, very sweet.  I think it smells great, but I just dont like the added sourness in the flavor compared with the aroma.  The flavor is much juicier and more sour, more like drinking juice than beer I think.

Pours a clear reddish-brownish color with a huge fluffy tan colored head.  Smells and tastes VERY hoppy, but well balanced.  In the aroma I get the rye, and some bread and caramel.  The rye really comes out in the flavor, along with some sweetness, maybe some grapes and grapefruit, a tiny bit of caramel, and a huge bitter finish.  Very good!

In appearance, this beer is a dark red color, almost pink, with a small white bubbly head.  It is very malty with sweet fruits (strawberry in particular), light toffee and caramel and light hops- aroma and flavor are similar.  I think this is both drinkable and flavorful, and I like the name.

In appearance, this is orange, clear, little or no head.  It smells like wheat and sweet juicy orange, maybe some banana.  It tastes similar, but also has a lot of spice and some vanilla creamyness.  Mild fruit and bitterness lingers.

A deep hazy brown/red color with a thin but dense tan colored head.  The aroma is sweet and hoppy but also has cinnamon, light fruits- maybe pineapple/citrus, vanilla and malt.  Delicious taste to go along with the aroma- it tastes rich and creamy with caramel and toffee, vanilla, spice, light citrus, nuts and well balanced hops and malt.  The palate is thick but very smooth.  Light toasted nuts linger.  I enjoyed all aspects of this beer and highly recommend it!

This beer is clear and orange in color with a small dense white head, and a good deal of carbonation.  There is mild pumpkin and cinnamon in the aroma, and a bit of peachy fruit.  Still has that same mild pumpkin and cinnamon in the flavor but also a fairly strong bitterness and more spice.  The spice really lingers.  I dont even like pumpkin at all but I thought this beer was ok.
